{(set: $bastille to "unstormed") }(border: "solid")[You are in an elevator. The dial permits you to choose any floor from 0 through 20. Please input the floor you desire.] <input type="text" data-varname="floorString"> <script>processInputElements();</script> (link-goto: "Done") <script>CustomScripts.updateBackground(-1);</script> At last the elevator comes to a halt. { ($setUpNewCentury:) } The elevator doors open to the $rightOnNexusMap and you [[step out->top left]].{(set: $place to "") (set: $NexusRoom to 0)<!--Nexus room nos end in 2--> (set: $decadeNum to 0) (set: $imageType to 0) <!--By running the following macro here in the passage, we get to reset the vocab each time we change passage using the "either" command in the vocab entries (if there is one). --> ($resetNexusVocab:) ($setNexusDirections: "hr1") } (border-color: grey) + (border:"solid") + (b4r-size:4) + (background: "https://i.ibb.co/RvgVfhk/grey-Background.png") [$mainSentence. You can either $head [[$rightOnNexusMap->top middle]] or [[$downOnNexusMap->four fifths up]]. (if: $floorInt is 6)[A ladder inside a cupola leads [[down->complex zero]] from here.] (else-if: $floorInt is 14)[The coast to the $upOnNexusMap opens into an estuary, via which you can [[sail inland->complex zero]].] (else-if: $floorInt is 19)[Alternatively, you can take a different line heading (link:"towards the Ukraine")[(set: $previousStop to "Moscow")(set:$nextStop to "farm")(goto:"train through countryside")].] (else:) [You may also $head $upOnNexusMap (print: (1) of $doorTypes) (print: (either: "", (2) of $doorTypes)) (print: (3) of $doorTypes) $exitPhrase [[$complexWord->complex zero]].] Another option is to step into the [[elevator]].]{ ($setImage:) ($setNexusImage:) (if: $floorInt is 17)[($overrideImage: "17001")] (if: $floorInt is 19)[($overrideImage: "19001")] ($setNexusDirections: "g1")}{(set: $place to "") (set: $NexusRoom to 1)<!--Nexus room nos end in 2--> (set: $decadeNum to 0) (set: $imageType to 0) <!--By running the following macro here in the passage, we get to reset the vocab each time we change passage using the "either" command in the vocab entries (if there is one). --> ($resetNexusVocab:) ($setNexusDirections: "g1") } (border-color: grey) + (border:"solid") + (b4r-size:4) + (background: "https://i.ibb.co/RvgVfhk/grey-Background.png") [$mainSentence. You may $head [[$rightOnNexusMap->top right]] or [[$leftOnNexusMap->top left]] from here. There is also (if: $floorInt is 6)[a rooftop entrance, from which a [[ladder descends->complex two]] into the building below.] (else:) [(if: $floorInt is 14)[the mouth of a river to the $downOnNexusMap, via which you can [[sail inland->complex two]].](else:) [a (print: (3) of $doorTypes) to the $downOnNexusMap (unless: $floorInt is 19)[which goes] $exitPhrase [[$complexWord->complex two]].] ] ]{ ($setImage:) ($setNexusImage:) (if: $hundredNumber is 1500)[($overrideImage:"1502")] (if: $hundredNumber is 1800)[($overrideImage:"1810")] (if: $floorInt is 17)[($overrideImage: "17002")] (if: $floorInt is 19)[($overrideImage: "19002")]}{(set: $place to "") (set: $NexusRoom to 3)<!--Nexus room nos end in 2--> (set: $decadeNum to 0) (set: $imageType to 0) <!--By running the following macro here in the passage, we get to reset the vocab each time we change passage using the "either" command in the vocab entries (if there is one). --> ($resetNexusVocab:) ($setNexusDirections: "stem") (set: $homeCity to "Bishop's Lynn") (set: $foreignCity to "La Rochelle")} (border-color: grey) + (border:"solid") + (b4r-size:4) + (background: "https://i.ibb.co/RvgVfhk/grey-Background.png") [$mainSentence. You may $head [[$upOnNexusMap->top left]] or [[$downOnNexusMap->three fifths up]] from here. (if: $floorInt is 6)[A ladder inside a cupola leads [[down->complex three]] from here.] (else:)[(if: $floorInt is 14)[To the $rightOnNexusMap you can see the coast opens up into an estuary, via which you can [[sail inland ->complex three]].] (else:) [To the $rightOnNexusMap is [[a (print: (3) of $doorTypes) via which you can $head $exitPhrase $complexWord->complex three]].] ] ]{ ($setImage:) ($setNexusImage:) (if: $hundredNumber is 1500)[($overrideImage:"1504")] (if: $hundredNumber is 1800)[($overrideImage:"1808")] (if: $floorInt is 17)[($overrideImage: "17004")] (if: $floorInt is 19)[($overrideImage: "19004")] }{ <!--SPECIFICS--> (set: $decadeNum to 0) ($setDecadeVariables:) <!--The following should be set differently for each complex entry point, so as to match the direction on screen from which we are exiting the nexus.--> (set: $directionIn to $upOnNexusMap) <!--The following function fixes the architecture by consulting the architecture database.--> ($chooseArchitecture:) <!--The following function requires directionIn and architecture to be set, and uses it to fix the startroom before flipping and rotating the map & changing the startRoom each time as appropriate.--> ($getComplexMap:) ($fixOptionalPaths:) ($setNexusWord:) ($refreshSentences:) <!--IMAGES--> (unless: $floorInt is 19)[($setImage:)](else:)[($overrideImage: "19101")] <!--END IMAGES--> <!--This fixes the text that permits one to leave the complex.--> (set: $returnText to "A different possibility is to head back to the $downOnNexusMap towards [[$nexusWord->complex zero]].") } (border-color: grey) + (border:"solid") + (b4r-size:4) + (background: "https://i.ibb.co/RvgVfhk/grey-Background.png")[{ (if: $floorInt is 6)[You are in one of the gatehouses to the city of Aleppo. A road leads [[$upOnNexusMap->$startRoom]] from here to the hanging farms. Alternatively you can go [[up a ladder->top left]] to $nexusWord.] (elseif: $floorInt is 14)[You are anchored in a wide, tropical river on an unexplored island in the new world. To explore the island, you must head [[$upOnNexusMap->$startRoom]] on foot. Alternatively you can $head [[$downOnNexusMap->top left]] to $nexusWord.] (elseif: $floorInt is 19)[You are at a small train station in the Ukrainian countryside. If you wish you can leave the station and [[explore the countryside nearby->$startRoom]]. (else:)[$complexSentence3. From here you can go $downOnNexusMap to [[$nexusWord->top left]]. Alternatively, you may go (link: $upOnNexusMap)[(goto: $startRoom)].]}] { <!--Called upon entry into a new century. Sets the variables accordingly.--> (set: $setUpNewCentury to (macro: [ ($setLooseVocab:) ($setCenturyVariables:) ($setNexusMovementTerm:) ($fixDirection:$floorInt) ($setDoorTypes:) ($setExitPhrase:) ($setReferenceMap:) ($setMapVariables:) (output-data:"") ])) <!--Dummy code to create arrows, in interface, to called functions --> [[ ->set reference map]] [[ ->head (Nexus Movement Term)]] [[ ->set century variables]] [[ ->fix direction]] [[ ->set up door types]] [[ ->set exit phrase (for Nexus)]] [[ ->set reference map]] [[ ->set map variables]] [[ ->set loose century vocab]] }{<!--This defines a movement term that is suitable to the century. E.g. if the character is moving around in a swamp, the movement term is set to "wade". It has to be set via a macro because it needs to be re-called, with new variable settings, whenever a new century is entered.--> (set: $setNexusMovementTerm to (macro: [ (set: $head to (cond: $floorInt is 8, "wade", $floorInt is 14, "sail a course", (either: "head", "go"))) (output-data:"") ])) }{ (set: $setCenturyVariables to (macro: [ (set: $floorInt to (num: $floorString)) (set: $hundredNumber to $floorInt*100) (set: $floorString2 to (str: $hundredNumber)) (output-data: "") ] )) }{ (set: $fixDirection to (macro: num-type _directionNum, [ (set: $directions to (cond: []}]}{ <!-- generates a map and starting point from the templates Presupposes: architecture and directionIn have been assigned Called by: in-game passages --> (set: $getComplexMap to (macro: [ ($setExceptionArchitectures:) ($setDefaultStartRoom:) ($setUpMapDebugging:) ($adjustStartRoom:) ($setDirections:) (output-data:"") ] )) <!--Dummy code to create arrows, in interface, to called functions --> [[ ->set default start room]] [[ ->set directions]] [[ ->adjust start room]] [[ ->set exception architectures]] }{ <!-- decides whether to flip the map left to right.--> (set: $randomFlipLR to (macro: [ (set: _randomFlipLR to ($srandom: 1)) (if: _randomFlipLR is 1) [ (set: $transform to $transform + (a: "flipLR")) (set: $rightOnScreen to ($flipCompass: $rightOnScreen)) (set: $leftOnScreen to ($flipCompass: $leftOnScreen)) (set: $rightDirections to $rightDirections + (a: $rightOnScreen)) (set: $upDirections to $upDirections + (a: $upOnScreen)) ($flipStartLR:) ] (output-data:"") ])) <!--Dummy code to create arrows, in interface, to called functions --> [[ ->srandom]] [[ ->flip compass]] [[ ->flip start left right]] }{ <!-- decides whether to flip the map up to down. Presupposes: setScreenValuesForFlat has been called, fixing values for upScreen and downScreen etc Called By: getComplexMap --> (set: $randomFlipUD to (macro: [ (set: _x to ($srandom: 1)) (if: _x is 1) [ (set: $transform to $transform + (a: "flipUD")) (set: $downOnScreen to ($flipCompass: $downOnScreen)) (set: $upOnScreen to ($flipCompass: $upOnScreen)) (set: $rightDirections to $rightDirections + (a: $rightOnScreen)) (set: $upDirections to $upDirections + (a: $upOnScreen)) ($flipStartUD:) ] (output-data:"") ])) <!--Dummy code to create arrows, in interface, to called functions --> [[ ->srandom]] [[ ->flip compass]] [[ ->flip start up down]] }{ <!-- rotates flat by random amount, 90 degree increments. Calls random number and does a series of < tests on it, rotating the flat by 90 degrees for each one it passes. Called By: getComplexMap --> (set: $rotateMapByRandom90 to (macro: [ (set: $rotation to 0) (set: _x to ($srandom: 3)) (if: _x < 1) [($rotateMap90:) (set: $rotation to $rotation + 90)] (if: _x < 2) [($rotateMap90:) (set: $rotation to $rotation + 90)] (if: _x < 3) [($rotateMap90:) (set: $rotation to $rotation + 90)] (set: $transform to $transform + (a: "rotate " + (str: $rotation))) (output-data:_x) ])) <!--Dummy code to create arrows, in interface, to called functions --> [[ ->srandom]] [[ ->rotate map 90]] }{ <!-- flips a given compass point, turning north to south, etc. Presupposes: it receives a compass point as argument Called By: flipFlatIfRandom --> (set: $flipCompass to (macro: str-type _direction, [ (set: _x to (cond: _direction is "north","south", _direction is "northeast","southwest", _direction is "east","west", _direction is "southeast","northwest", _direction is "south","north", _direction is "southwest","northeast", _direction is "west","east", _direction is "northwest","southeast", "error: flipCompass not given a compass direction")) (output-data:_x) ])) }{ <!-- maps a start room onto its nearest opposite start room at the other side of the map. Presupposes: startRoom has been assigned. The entrances listed are opposite. From here you may go [[$rightHill_5 $rightOnScreen->right entrance]] or [[$upHill_1 $upOnScreen->passage 8]]. + " to the ")] (if: _slopePhrase's 1st is "d") [(set: $slope to "up " + $slopeTerm + " to the ")] ] (output-data:$slope) ] )) [[ ->slope language]] }{ (set: $slopeLanguage to (macro: [ (set: language]] [[ ->srandom]] }{ (set: $setRoomPhrase2 to (macro: [ (set: $roomNoun to 2nd of (str: $decadeReference) of $roomTerms) (set: $roomAdj to 1st of (str: $decadeReference) of $roomTerms) (if: Turning, you see several buildings on fire, and more fiery arrows tracing arcs through the sky. You may turn to [[hurry back->complex nine]] the way you came, or you can [[continue to explore->$startRoom]] despite the fires.
